sections.heading: Change Beneficiary PROCESS
content: The following steps outline the detailed flow of the process, from initiation to approval. Each step has been structured to ensure clarity, precision, and a smooth user experience.

subsections.heading: INITIATOR PROCESS
content: Login: The ASM team logs in to the Manch application using the provided credentials.
Single Transaction:
The ASM team can start a new transaction by clicking Create > Onboarding request > select the template and enter all the details( refer below mentioned table) and submit
Note: We have to create a master data (EDV) for getting below information based on the outlet code. Master data (EDV) format needs to be shared by UB team.

subsections.heading: SPOC BEHAVIOR
content: SMS Notification: An SMS containing a link is sent to the SPOC’s mobile number.
OTP Authentication:
The SPOC opens the link and receives an OTP (One-Time Password) for additional authentication.
The SPOC enters the OTP, and after successful verification, the Manch platform opens the link.
Outlet Code Entry:  The SPOC enters the Outlet Code, which is validated by the Manch system against the code associated with the generated link.
Add a new question “Do you want to change your current beneficiary?”
Values : Yes and No
Agreement to Policies:
Upon accessing the link, the SPOC is prompted to agree to the data privacy policy and terms of conditions (Change beneficiary -same TOC (outlet kyc).
Form Opening: Manch will open the form and SPOC needs to enter the required details as mentioned below
Note: Details will change based on the answer given by SPOC and validated by MANCH with the system data.

subsections.heading: APPROVER PROCESS
content: Assignment to Approver: Once all the mandatory fields are entered, validated, and the request is submitted, the system automatically assigns the request to the appropriate approver.
Individual Approval (Without Group concept) :
The approval flow for individuals will only be routed to the TSE approvers in two specific cases, followed by the UB team as mentioned below.
In all other scenarios, it directly goes to the UB team.
Establishment Approval (Without Group concept): All requests will it directly goes to the UB team.
Group approval: All requests will first go to the ASM and then proceed to the UB team.
Note – The assignment is based on outlet code mapping to ensure the request reaches the correct approver for review UB team needs to provide the TSE, ASM and State mapping based on outlet code.
Approver access: Approvers have two methods to access the transaction, review and act on requests as mentioned below -
Email and SMS Notification:
The Manch system sends an email and SMS notification to the approver with a link to review the request.
The approver clicks the link to access all request details and can either approve or reject the request based on the provided information.
Manch System Login:
The approver can log in to the Manch system, navigate to the "Pending Requests" section, and review the details.
After reviewing, the approver can either approve or reject the request.
TSE View and Action
Log into the Manch system: TSE logs into the Manch system and views all pending requests.
Open the transaction: TSE opens a transaction to see the details mentioned below:
Outlet code
Outlet name
Licensee name
Beneficiary name
Authorization-letter
Respond to mandatory question: TSE answers the mandatory question: "Are you approving this request?" by selecting either "Yes" or "No" from the dropdown menu.
Approve or Reject the request:
If TSE clicks "Approve," It will submit. The request then moves to the next level of approver.
If TSE clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown and submit it. The request returns to the SPOC for necessary modifications.
Resubmit by SPOC : Once the SPOC submits the required details, the request assigns back to TSE, who can then repeat the approval or rejection process as outlined above.
ASM View and Action
Log into the Manch system: ASM logs into the Manch system and views all pending requests.
Open the transaction: ASM opens a transaction to see the details uploaded in the bulk file, details entered by the SPOC, along with the relevant documents.
Approve or reject the request:
If ASM clicks "Approve," It will submit. The request then moves to the next level of approver.
If ASM clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request returns to the SPOC for necessary modifications
Resubmit by SPOC : Once the SPOC submits the required details, the request assigns back to ASM, who can then repeat the approval or rejection process as outlined above.
UB approver View and Action
Log into the Manch system: UB approver logs into the Manch system and views all pending requests.
Open the transaction:
Individual Use case :
UB approver opens a transaction to see the details uploaded in the bulk file, and details entered by the SPOC, along with the relevant documents.
Group Use case :
UB approver opens a transaction to see the details uploaded in the bulk file, and details entered by the SPOC, along with the relevant documents.
UB approver sees group member details along with uploaded documents and match score.
Approve or reject the request:
If UB approver clicks "Approve," It will submit. The request then moves to Accepted status.
If UB approver clicks "Reject," they select a rejection reason from a dropdown (configured based on UB rejection reasons) and submit it. The request returns to the SPOC for necessary modifications.
Resubmit by SPOC :

Once the SPOC submits the required details, the request assigns back to TSE(In case of individual use cases) or ASM (In case of group use cases) who can then repeat the approval or rejection process as outlined above
If UB team rejects it will assign back to SPOC and enter the details
Once SPOC resubmits, it will be reassigned to ASM / TSE, and ASM /TSE needs to take the actions mentioned in the ASM / TSE section.
Once ASM resubmits, it will be reassigned to UB Team, and UB Team needs to take the actions mentioned in the UB Team section.
Once UB team submit the transaction, it will be in Accepted status.
If any of the approvals again rejects the re-submitted outlets information then it will go through the same flow as mentioned above.

Upon accessing the link, the SPOC is prompted to agree to the data privacy policy and terms of conditions (Change beneficiary -same TOC (outlet kyc).

Individual Approval (Without Group concept) :
The approval flow for individuals will only be routed to the TSE approvers in two specific cases, followed by the UB team as mentioned below.
In all other scenarios, it directly goes to the UB team.
Establishment Approval (Without Group concept): All requests will it directly goes to the UB team.
Group approval: All requests will first go to the ASM and then proceed to the UB team.
Approver access: Approvers have two methods to access the transaction, review and act on requests as mentioned below -
Email and SMS Notification:
The Manch system sends an email and SMS notification to the approver with a link to review the request.
The approver clicks the link to access all request details and can either approve or reject the request based on the provided information.
Manch System Login:
The approver can log in to the Manch system, navigate to the "Pending Requests" section, and review the details.
After reviewing, the approver can either approve or reject the request.

Log into the Manch system: TSE logs into the Manch system and views all pending requests.
Open the transaction: TSE opens a transaction to see the details mentioned below:

Once the SPOC submits the required details, the request assigns back to TSE(In case of individual use cases) or ASM (In case of group use cases) who can then repeat the approval or rejection process as outlined above

Once SPOC resubmits, it will be reassigned to ASM / TSE, and ASM /TSE needs to take the actions mentioned in the ASM / TSE section.

Once UB team submit the transaction, it will be in Accepted status.
If any of the approvals again rejects the re-submitted outlets information then it will go through the same flow as mentioned above.

The SPOC can view the following details: Licensee is an individual Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Individual Are you a group owner? – No Who is the new beneficiary? - Licensee [ The SPOC will be able to view the previous PAN, account number, and IFSC number in a non-editable format, along with fields to upload new PAN, bank details, and other relevant information]

Licensee is an individual Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Individual Are you a group owner? – No Who is the new beneficiary? - Other Beneficiary [ The SPOC will be able to view the previous PAN, account number, and IFSC number in a non-editable format, along with fields to upload new PAN, bank details, and other relevant information]

Licensee is an individual Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Individual Are you a group owner? – No Who is the new beneficiary? - Other Beneficiary [ The SPOC will be able to view the previous PAN, account number, and IFSC number in a non-editable format, along with fields to upload new PAN, bank details, and other relevant information]

Licensee is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? Establishment Are you a group owner? – No Who is the new beneficiary? - Establishment [ The SPOC will be able to view the previous PAN, account number, and IFSC number in a non-editable format, along with fields to upload new PAN, bank details, and other relevant information]

Licensee is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? Establishment Are you a group owner? – No Who is the new beneficiary? - Proprietor [ The SPOC will be able to view the previous PAN, account number, and IFSC number in a non-editable format, along with fields to upload new PAN, bank details, and other relevant information]
Licensee is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? Establishment Are you a group owner? – No Who is the new beneficiary? – Other Beneficiary
Group owner is individual licensee Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Individual Are you a group owner? – Yes Who is the new beneficiary? - Group owner
Group owner is individual licensee Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Individual Are you a group owner? – Yes Who is the new beneficiary? - Other Beneficiary
Group owner is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? – Establishment Are you a group owner? – Yes Who is the new beneficiary? – Group owner
Group owner is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Establishment Are you a group owner?– Yes Who is the new beneficiary? -Proprietor
Group owner is an establishment Is the license under an Individual or an Establishment? - Establishment Are you a group owner?– Yes Who is the new beneficiary? - Other Beneficiary
